abstract: 3 discs. (discs 4 & 5 180 mins each; disc 6 90 mins) Disc 4: Eps. 13-16 Surprise; Innocence; Phases; Bewitched, bothered and bewildered--Disc 5: Eps. 17-20 Passion; Killed by death; I only have eyes for you; Go fish--Disc 6: Eps. 21-22: Becoming, Part one; Becoming, Part two
description: Episode of Series "Buffy the vampire slayer". Season two of Joss Whedon's cult series saw the introduction of Vampires Spike (James Masterson) and Drusilla (Juliet Landau) (Ep. 3 School hard), this seasons resident 'big-bads'. This was the year that Buffy the Vampire slayer's popularity went from small cult following to full blown media event, gaining some of the highest ratings the show has ever had in the US. Season two also saw the introduction of the cool and mysterious Oz (Seth Green), who became a 'Scooby gang' regular and a potential love interest for Willow. Unfortunately, like everything else in Sunnydale High, gateway to the hellmouth, Oz has teen issues of the supernatural kind (Ep. 15, Phases). Love is also in the air for Zander (Nicholas Brendan) as he hooks up with the 'cliquey' Cordelia (Charisma Carpenter), an unlikely pairing which results in much bitchy repartee (Ep. 10, What's my line, Part two). Aside from a new slayer unexpectedly arriving on the scene (Ep. 9, What's my line, Part One), season two's biggest surprise ended up being the transformation of Buffy's `soulful' boyfriend Angel (David Boreanaz) into the uber evil, Angelus (Ep. 13, Surprise and Ep. 14, Innocence). This causes the love struck Buffy much grief as she has to make some difficult and painful decisions (Ep. 22, Becoming, Part two). Meanwhile, Angelus makes it his personal mission to make the slayer's life hell (Ep. 17, Passion), while joining forces with Spike and Drusilla as they attempt to awaken a demon that will suck the world into hell (Ep. 21, Becoming, Part one and Ep. 22, Becoming, Part two). Cast includes: Sarah Michele Gellar, Alyson Hannigan, Nicholas Brendan, Anthony Stewart Head.
